Description: Sets the name of the server that is shown in the server list
Sets an optional short name for the server. Maximum 32 characters
Sets an optional description for the server that is visible in the server browser when the server is selected. Maximum 4096 characters
Sets an optional contact email address or website (where players may contact the server owner)
If set, the server will be visible in the server list
Sets the password to join the server. Default is no password
Sets a semicolon-separated list of UIDs of server admins
Sets a relative path to an optional server header image (shown in the server browser if a user selects the server). Recommended size: 1024x512 px
If set, the server will only accept players whose UIDs are in the 'whitelist' file
If set, the server will block all players whose UIDs are in the 'blacklist' file
If set, the server ensures that no player uses a reserved name (unless their UID matches)
If set, SQLite won't set up a savepoint or use a transaction when performing a world conversion
If set, the server will check if any of the server ports (UDP and TCP) are already in use
Sets the server target framerate (only affects the main thread)
Sets how often Steam tries to reconnect after losing connection. -1 = unlimited retries
Sets the period after which old server logs should be deleted. -1 = keep all
Sets the name of the world to load, or to create if it does not exist
Sets the seed used to create a new world. Blank = random seed
Sets the default world game mode when creating a new world
Sets the default elevation of terrain in newly created superflat worlds
Sets the default terrain ID for newly created superflat worlds
Sets the world flatness factor when creating a new world
Sets the world ore amount when creating a new world
If set, the game will automatically create a backup of the world when performing a conversion (after an update)
Sets an optional comma-separated list of disabled NPCs
If set, caves will be disabled
If set, the ocean (water) will be disabled
If set, vegetation will be disabled
Sets the world terrain type. Example: 'Default', 'Superflat' or 'FlatIslands'
If disabled, the game will no longer save world changes
Sets the game mode to run the server with
Sets the maximum number of players allowed on the server at one time
If set, the global chat will be active
If set, emojis will be shown in chat (depending on player permissions)
Sets the time period until an unused chunk gets disposed. Low values reduce memory consumption, high values improve performance
Sets the number of chunk worker threads. 0 = automatic assignment
Sets the factor to modify the duration it takes to cook or process food. Example: 0.5 = cooking takes half the time
If set, crafting progression is enabled, meaning recipes need to be unlocked first before they're available
Sets the time until dead bodies despawn
Sets the period after which old world event entries will be deleted. -1 = keep all entries
If set, floating objects (like furniture) break under certain circumstances
If set, floating plants break under certain circumstances
Sets the factor to modify the duration until a player gets hungry/thirsty. Smaller values make the player more hungry/thirsty
If too many illegal states are detected for a player, they will be kicked from the server
Sets the time until a dropped item despawns
Sets the factor for how durable items are. Examples: 2 = items are twice as durable, 0.5 = half durability. -1 = infinite durability
If set, player world events (such as placing or removing elements or terrain) will be tracked and logged
Sets the resolution of a map tile (per sector). High values consume more memory (and more VRAM on clientside)
Sets how many NPCs are allowed on the server. -1 = no limit
Sets an optional pre-defined moon phase. If set, this moon phase will always be active. Blank = varying moon phases
Sets the scale factor for the moon
If set, killed NPCs will drop their equipped items
Sets the cooldown until the game tries to respawn enemy npcs (monsters, bandits) in a chunk
Sets the factor for the damage dealt by NPCs
Sets the cooldown until the game tries to respawn NPCs in a chunk
If set, monsters will spawn at the surface at night. They will disappear at dawn
Sets the spawn rate for animals. Lower values for less animals, higher values for more
Sets the spawn rate for bandits and similar enemies. Lower values for less enemies, higher values for more
Sets the spawn rate for surface monsters during night. Lower values for less enemies, higher values for more
Sets the spawn rate for monsters which spawn underground (dungeons, hell etc). Lower values for less enemies, higher values for more
If set, surface skeletons will spawn with a torch at night (making them more visible)
If a floating object breaks, it will spawn as an item if its place time is less than this value
Sets the factor to modify the duration it takes to smelt ores. Example: 0.5 = smelting takes half the time
Sets an override for the deep underground location name ('Deep Underground')
Sets an override for the default location name ('Wilderness')
Sets an override for the hell location name ('Hell')
Sets an override for the orbit location name ('Orbit')
Set an override for the underground location name ('Underground')
If set, the server will try to merge world items when spawning several at once (performance reasons)
If set, peaceful mode will be active, meaning enemies do not attack (unless provoked)
If set, blocks will be picked up automatically when deconstructing them with a sledgehammer
Sets the factor to modify the duration it takes for plants to grow. Example: 0.5 = growth is twice as fast
If set, the player list (i) will show the distance to other players
If set, the player list (i) will show the permission group of other players
If set, the player list (i) will show the total playtime of other players
Sets how many 'undo' steps are tracked per player
Sets how long an undo step is valid
If set, players will hear a heartbeat sound when being detected by a hostile NPC
If set, the server will be advertised as a PvE server (this alone does not affect the gameplay)
If set, the server will be advertised as a PvP server (this alone does not affect the gameplay)
If set, there will be different weather per region (each region overrides the global weather)
If set, seasons will be enabled
If set, general messages (time of day or weather changed) will show up in the chat
Sets how long the current location should be shown to the player. -1 = always show the location
If set, all players will be notified when a player connects to the server
If set, all players will be notified when a player dies
If set, all players will see why a player died (only if Show Player Death Message is enabled)
If set, all players will be notified when a player leaves the server
If set, all players will be visible on the in-game map
If set, a restart reminder will be sent to all admins if the server is running for more than 24 hours
If set, clients will be allowed to skip the loading screen when connecting to the server
Sets the optional rotation (in degrees) of the sky (determines where the sun rises and sets)
If set, chests will spawn all their content as world items if a player breaks them. May have performance implications
Sets the player spawn protection period. Newly spawned players won't get attacked by NPCs during the spawn protection period
Sets the initial weather effect (such as 'fog', 'rain' etc). Blank = default weather
Sets the duration (in real time) of one in-game day
Sets how often flowing water should be updated. 0 = disable flowing water
Sets how often flowing water updates should be synced with clients
Sets the number of water worker threads (responsible for handling water updates). 0 = automatic assignment
Sets the factor to modify the time until the weather changes. Example: 0.5 = weather changes twice as frequently
Sets the weather preset
If set, the database runs in RAM (faster) and is only stored periodically on disk. Increases memory usage
Sets the save interval for the database being saved to disk when using the in-memory database
Sets the journal mode. It's recommended to use WAL (Write-Ahead Logging)
Sets the synchronous mode
If set, the RCON tool will be enabled
If set, allows the use of a custom RCON tool (disables the built-in RCON tool)
Sets the RCON certificate path (relative to the server directory)
Sets the RCON certificate password
Sets the RCON IP binding. Blank = default server IP
Sets the password required for RCON login. Minimum 6 characters
Sets a semicolon-separated lists of IPs that can access the RCON tool
If true, plugins will be loaded. If disabled, no Java VM will be created
Sets the amount of heap memory for the Java VM
Sets a semicolon-separated list of Java VM options
If true, the game will track event call durations and also detects infinite loops in plugin event methods
Sets the maximum allowed duration of event calls until a log message is printed. Debug Plugin Events must be enabled
Sets the maximum number of plugin errors until the server throws an exception
If set, the Java VM will not generate hs_err_pid files in case of a native crash
Sets the default permission group for new players. Blank = default permissions
If set, server admins get full permissions, irrespective of their actual permission group
